items.title: Vaarwel supersterren, welkom succes: de volmaakte wervelwind van Luis Enrique
items.summary: Paris Saint-Germain strandde twaalf keer op rij in de knock-outfase, maar in 2025 was het raak in de Champions League. Uitgerekend in het seizoen na het vertrek van de laatste superster kroonden de Parijzenaars zich tot kampioen van Europa. Vooruitgestuwd door de eigenzinnige Luis Enrique.

items.title: Premier League buildup and latest news ‚Äì matchday live
items.summary: News, discussion and buildup to the day‚Äôs action Get in touch! Email us with your thoughts here Wissa needs more time to get over knee injury Yoane Wissa is still not ready to make regular starts for Newcastle but Eddie Howe is keen to find the Congolese striker more opportunities in the coming weeks. I think with Yoane, we‚Äôve got to look after him, he‚Äôs still relatively early in his return. He did really well in his one start against Fulham, I was really pleased with him that day and there‚Äôll be other opportunities. The problem for us is with our schedule playing every three, four days, I don‚Äôt think he‚Äôs in a condition where he could start regularly at the moment. Hopefully we can manage him to that point at some stage. Continue reading...

items.title: 'Magical december' voor Antwerp, dankzij Oranje-trio Kerk, Janssen √©n Oosting
items.summary: Antwerp FC is terug op weg naar de top van Belgi√´. Sinds de aanstelling van trainer Joseph Oosting gaat het The Great Old voor de wind. Met dank aan twee Nederlandse spitsen: Gyrano Kerk en Vincent Janssen. Ook zaterdag werd er gewonnen. Van Zulte-Waregem: 2-1.

items.title: England cope with the chaos to give fans some Christmas cheer
items.summary: Here is a little rundown for you.

items.title: Lof voor Frimpong en Wirtz bij zege Liverpool: 'Hij had wat meer tijd nodig'
items.summary: Liverpool stormde dankzij de zege op Wolverhampton Wanderers de topvier binnen. Wat schreven de Engelse media over de ploeg van manager Arne Slot? Een overzicht.

items.title: Heaven will not switch from England to Ghana
items.summary: Manchester United defender Ayden Heaven, who qualifies for Ghana through a grandparent, wants to play for England at senior level.

items.title: Spalletti kritisch op Koopmeiners: 'Niet kwaliteiten getoond die nodig zijn'
items.summary: Luciano Spalletti is niet tevreden over Teun Koopmeiners. Dat liet de trainer van Juventus zaterdag weten na de uitzege op Pisa (0-2). De middenvelder van het Nederlands elftal viel de coach in negatieve zin op.

items.title: Waarom Diba salaris van NAC weigert: 'Doe maar twee seizoenkaarten'
items.summary: Niet iedereen die Anouar Diba (42) vroeger volgde als voetballer, zou er een latere trainer ingezien hebben. Vanaf het nieuwe jaar wordt de voormalige pingelaar echter toegevoegd aan de technische staf van NAC Breda . De linkspoot weigert een salaris te ontvangen, maar heeft w√©l een zeer bijzondere prestatiebonus voor ogen: twee seizoenkaarten.

items.title: Chelsea & Leeds monitoring McAtee - Sunday's gossip
items.summary: Chelsea and Leeds United among clubs interested in James McAtee, Arsenal considering move for Davide Bartesaghi, Manu Kone set to move to Manchester United in the summer, plus more.

items.title: Today on Sky Sports Racing: Raging Raj looks to complete hat-trick at Southwell
items.summary: Southwell opens its gates for action on the level this afternoon - live on Sky Sports Racing.

items.title: MCG pitch curator in 'state of shock' after whirlwind two-day Ashes Test
items.summary: Melbourne Cricket Ground pitch curator Matthew Page says he is in a "state of shock" after the Boxing Day Ashes Test at the venue lasted just two days and has vowed to "get it right next year".

items.title: Who should everyone else worry about? Aston Villa, the Premier League's hottest team
items.summary: Aston Villa are on a historic hot streak, and they can absolutely challenge for the Premier League title.

items.title: For a team topping the Premier League table, Arsenal haven't looked convincing enough
items.summary: Arsenal relied on an own goal for their fourth straight match, and it's not convincing enough.

items.title: Watkins brace seals Villa an 11th consecutive win
items.summary: Aston Villa's remarkable winning run continued as Ollie Watkins came off the bench in the second half to score twice and earn a valuable 2-1 victory over Chelsea.

items.title: Slot: Wirtz 'relieved' after Liverpool goal
items.summary: Arne Slot has described Florian Wirtz display in Liverpool's 2-1 victory over Wolverhampton Wanderers as "special".

items.title: Arteta warns Arsenal's composure must improve
items.summary: Mikel Arteta has warned that Arsenal must show more composure to close out games after his team secured a nervy 2-1 win over Brighton on Saturday.

items.title: Littler thrashes Suljovic with statement win as Bunting dumped out
items.summary: Luke Littler thrashed Mensur Suljovic with a statement 4-0 win in the third round as Stephen Bunting was knocked out of the World Darts Championship by James Hurrell.

items.title: Leinster hold on for feisty Irish derby win at Munster as ref booed off
items.summary: Leinster held on to register a feisty URC interprovincial Irish derby win against Munster, winning 13-8 at Thomond Park.

items.title: Villa have been here before - but are they really in title race?
items.summary: Aston Villa have been here before and fallen away - but they must now be taken seriously as title contenders, writes Phil McNulty.

items.title: Monolithic belief of Guardiolismo has fractured in new era for tactics | Jonathan Wilson
items.summary: The old ways are over and nobody is entirely sure what is to follow but football revolutions once experienced are never forgotten If you want a picture of the future, imagine Michael Kayode winding up to take a long throw ‚Äì forever. Or at least that was how it seemed in October. Already, though, the picture has begun to change. This was the year of the backlash, and then a bit of a backlash to the backlash. For almost two decades football had accepted the guardiolista consensus. Football was about possession, about the press, but most of all about position, about the careful manipulation of space. Much-improved pitches meant first touches could be taken for granted: players receiving the ball didn‚Äôt have to focus on getting it under control but could instead be parsing their options. The game had become chess with a ball, a matter of strategy more than physicality. Continue reading...
